subject: Education
title: Open Educational Resources: Knowledge Wants to Be Free
description: A 60-second lesson on Open Educational Resources: Knowledge Wants to Be Free.

hook.text: A college textbook costs $200. The same content exists free online, written by MIT professors.

buildup.text: Open Educational Resources are teaching materials freely available for anyone to use and adapt.

discovery.text: OER saves students billions in textbook costs while maintaining comparable academic outcomes.

twist.text: Most professors still assign expensive textbooksâ€”inertia and publisher marketing are powerful forces.

climax.text: Institutions adopting OER see higher enrollment, lower dropout, and equal student performance.

punchline.text: The best textbook is the one every student can actually afford to open.

quiz.question: What do studies show about OER compared to traditional textbooks?
options: Students achieve comparable outcomes while saving significantly on costs
OER consistently leads to lower academic performance
Open resources are only available for humanities courses
